item.title: Compiling Error
item.dc:creator: @Wildcat_240 Wildcat_240
item.description:
@Wildcat_240 wrote:

Well, I was putting Silab’s Items into my server, and got an error on the last step…

It says: client.java11937: illegal start of expression }public int itemType(int item) {

1 error

Here’s what I’m Editing: public int itemType(int item) { for (int i = 0; i < Item.capes.length; i++) { if(item == Item.capes[i]) { return playerCape; } } for (int i = 0; i < Item.hats.length; i++) { if(item == Item.hats[i]) { return playerHat; } } for (int i = 0; i < Item.boots.length; i++) { if(item == Item.boots[i]) { return playerFeet; } } for (int i = 0; i < Item.gloves.length; i++) { if(item == Item.gloves[i]) { return playerHands; } } for (int i = 0; i < Item.shields.length; i++) { if(item == Item.shields[i]) { return playerShield; } } for (int i = 0; i < Item.amulets.length; i++) { if(item == Item.amulets[i]) { return playerAmulet; } } for (int i = 0; i < Item.arrows.length; i++) { if(item == Item.arrows[i]) { return playerArrows; } } for (int i = 0; i < Item.rings.length; i++) { if(item == Item.rings[i]) { return playerRing; } } for (int i = 0; i < Item.body.length; i++) { if(item == Item.body[i]) { return playerChest; } } for (int i = 0; i < Item.legs.length; i++) { if(item == Item.legs[i]) { return playerLegs; } }public int itemType(int item) { for (int i = 0; i < Item.capes.length; i++) { if(item == Item.capes[i]) { return playerCape; } } for (int i = 0; i < Item.hats.length; i++) { if(item == Item.hats[i]) { return playerHat; } } for (int i = 0; i < Item.boots.length; i++) { if(item == Item.boots[i]) { return playerFeet; } } for (int i = 0; i < Item.gloves.length; i++) { if(item == Item.gloves[i]) { return playerHands; } } for (int i = 0; i < Item.shields.length; i++) { if(item == Item.shields[i]) { return playerShield; } } for (int i = 0; i < Item.amulets.length; i++) { if(item == Item.amulets[i]) { return playerAmulet; } } for (int i = 0; i < Item.arrows.length; i++) { if(item == Item.arrows[i]) { return playerArrows; } } for (int i = 0; i < Item.rings.length; i++) { if(item == Item.rings[i]) { return playerRing; } } for (int i = 0; i < Item.body.length; i++) { if(item == Item.body[i]) { return playerChest; } } for (int i = 0; i < Item.legs.length; i++) { if(item == Item.legs[i]) { return playerLegs; } } I think that’s too much, I think i’m supposed to stop at the first “playerLegs” but, meh.

Thanks in Advance!
